content.title: Cervical Spine Anterior Access
content.definition: Surgical exposure of the anterior cervical spine for discectomy, fusion, or corpectomy procedures, requiring protection of carotid and vertebral arteries and jugular veins.

key_concepts.description: Standard anterior approach through natural tissue planes between carotid sheath laterally and trachea/esophagus medially.
Carotid artery and internal jugular vein lateral. Vertebral artery in transverse foramina C6-C1. Inferior thyroid artery crosses C5-6.
C3-C7 through standard anterior approach. Upper cervical (C1-C2) requires specialized transoral or retropharyngeal approaches.

technique.positioning: Supine, slight neck extension, head turned slightly away (or neutral)

side_selection.left_sided: Consider for prior right neck surgery, to protect recurrent laryngeal nerve at specific levels

technique.incision: Transverse along skin crease at target level, or oblique along anterior SCM border

exposure.superficial: Divide platysma, identify SCM and strap muscles
exposure.deep: Enter between carotid sheath (lateral) and trachea/esophagus (medial)
exposure.target: Longus colli muscles, anterior longitudinal ligament, vertebral bodies

vascular_protection.carotid_sheath: Retract laterally with gentle self-retaining retractor
vascular_protection.vertebral_artery: Protected by longus colli - do not dissect laterally beyond this muscle
vascular_protection.inferior_thyroid: May require ligation at C5-6 level

carotid_artery.risk: Retraction injury, especially with atherosclerotic disease
carotid_artery.prevention: Gentle retraction, intermittent release, preoperative carotid imaging if stenosis suspected

vertebral_artery.location: Enters transverse foramen at C6 (usually), ascends through foramina to skull base
vertebral_artery.injury_risk: Drilling or dissection lateral to longus colli
vertebral_artery.management: Direct pressure, hemostatic agents, consider endovascular management

venous.structures: Internal jugular vein, anterior jugular vein

vascular.carotid: Rare stroke from retraction injury or plaque embolization
vascular.management: Immediate vascular surgery consultation, consider endovascular repair

content.statement: Cervical Spine Anterior Access is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Spine-Access that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Cervical Spine Anterior Access helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Cervical Spine Anterior Access include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Cervical Spine Anterior Access.

learning_objectives: Describe the anterior cervical approach and tissue planes
Identify vascular structures at risk during anterior cervical surgery
Explain techniques to protect the vertebral artery
clinical_pearls: Never dissect lateral to longus colli - vertebral artery is just beyond
Preoperative carotid imaging for patients with risk factors
Intermittent retractor release reduces carotid injury
Left-sided approach may protect recurrent laryngeal nerve at C5-7
